intro: Trichinium rotundifolium, commonly known as the round-leaved trichinium, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of South America. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its aromatic foliage. The plant features round, heart-shaped leaves and produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels. It is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and stream banks. Trichinium rotundifolium is valued for its medicinal properties and is used in traditional herbal remedies.
